text: Claude Earl "Chuck" Rayner (August 11, 1920 – October 6, 2002) was a Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender. He played nine seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played for the Brooklyn Americans and New York Rangers. He was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1973. ==Awards & achievements== *Turnbull Cup MJHL Championship (1940) *AHL Second All-Star Team (1941) *NHL Second All-Star Team (1949, 1950, & 1951) *Hart Memorial Trophy Winner (1950) *Played in the NHL All-Star Game (1949, 1950, & 1951) *Inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1973 *“Honoured Member” of the Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame ==Other websites== * * *Chuck Rayner's biography at Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame Category:1920 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Hart Memorial Trophy winners Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:New Haven Ramblers players Category:New York Americans players Category:New York Rangers players Category:Springfield Indians players
title: Chuck Rayner
